meanings.definition: A room in which photographs are developed and printed.
meanings.sent1: In the darkrooms, photographers develop their pictures.
meanings.sent2: The darkrooms at the photography studio are always busy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ghost refuse to enter the darkrooms? Because it didn't want to be captured on film!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a darkroom, developing memories slowly and carefully.
meanings.sent5: The darkrooms smelled of chemicals and creativity, a unique blend.

meanings.definition: A room without windows used for developing photographs.
meanings.sent1: The darkrooms in the basement are perfect for developing photos.
meanings.sent2: Photographers prefer working in darkrooms to control the light exposure.
meanings.sent3: Why did the vampire feel at home in the darkrooms? Because he could work without sunlight!
meanings.sent4: His heart was a darkroom, where memories developed in the absence of light.
meanings.sent5: The darkrooms were like hidden caves where images came to life in the shadows.

meanings.definition: A darkened room used for developing film.
meanings.sent1: The filmmaker spent hours in the darkrooms perfecting each frame.
meanings.sent2: Darkrooms are essential for creating high-quality film prints.
meanings.sent3: Why did the detective investigate the darkrooms? To uncover the mystery of the missing negatives!
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like film negatives, waiting to be developed in the darkroom of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The darkrooms were like magical chambers where images emerged from the darkness.
